column3: "The troll scratches his head in confusion, then takes the axe." CR>
column4: Giving the troll his axe back when you have it in your inventory. Dangerous to yourself.

column3: "The troll, who is remarkably coordinated, catches the " D ,PRSO>
column4: Throwing a generic object at the troll. The troll catches the object.
column6: Is the object a weapon or something that could be harmful if thrown?

column3: " and eats it hungrily. Poor troll, he dies from an internal hemorrhageand his carcass disappears in a sinister black fog." CR>
column4: Troll accepted your gift of a weapon and ate it. Troll died a horrible death as a result.

column3: " and, being for the moment sated, throws it back. Fortunately, thetroll has poor control, and the " D ,PRSO " falls to the floor. He doesnot look pleased." CR>
column4: Giving the troll a weapon. The troll throws it back.

column3: " and not having the most discriminating tastes, gleefully eats it." CR>
column4: You give the troll a non-weapon. The troll eats it. (it could be food)
column6: Needs conditioning. If you feed/give the troll something you know to be poisonous, that could be bad.

column3: <VERB? MUNG> <TELL"The troll laughs at your puny gesture." CR>
column4: You try to destroy the troll. Unsuccessful. Troll is a bad guy.

column3: "The leaves burn." CR>
column4: You burn leaves in a forest. Potential for forest fire.
column5: What is the season? Is the forest obviously damp?

column3: <JIGS-UP"The leaves burn, and so do you.">
column4: You burn leaves in a forest and you burn to death as a result.
column5: The logic for this branch is weird. Is this a bug in the source code? Test this out with Jericho.

column3: <JIGS-UP"As the knife approaches its victim, your mind is submerged by anovermastering will. Slowly, your hand turns, until the rusty bladeis an inch from your neck. The knife seems to sing as it savagelyslits your throat.">
column4: Freak harmful accident. You attack someone with a rusty knife, but it kills you instead.

column3: "A ghost appears in the room and is appalled at your desecration ofthe remains of a fellow adventurer. He casts a curse on your valuablesand banishes them to the Land of the Living Dead. The ghost leaves,muttering obscenities." CR>
column4: Desecrating a skeleton, e.g. attacking, moving, or kissing it. Some of these things are worse than others. A ghost steals all your stuff.

column4: Putting out torch with no indirect object.

column3: "Oh dear. It appears that the smell coming from this room was coal gas.I would have thought twice about carrying flaming objects in here." CR>

column5: Out of curiosity, what happens if you try to light a candle in this room but you don’t have the candles in your inventory? Is this handled in a routine with higher priority?
